reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling Up Malaria Prevention, Control and Treatment Through All Sectors in Liberia

description.narrative: Liberia - Malaria - Plan International, Inc. - Plan International Liberia. This program has the following goals: By 2020, reduce illness and deaths caused by malaria by 50%.. To ensure equitable access to essential medical products, vaccines and technologies of assured quality, safety, efficacy and cost-effectiveness.. To improve the health status of the Liberian population through building a resilient health system.. The objectives of this program are: To increase access to prompt diagnosis and effective treatment targeting 85% of population by 2020.. Ensure that 80% of the population is protected by malaria preventive measures by 2020.. Increase the proportion of the population with knowledge and practice of malaria preventive measures to 95% and 75% by the end of 2020.. Strengthen the supply chain system for effective quantification and prompt distribution of commodities under a universal system by 2020.. To improve routine data monitoring and program evaluation to ensure quality data management at all levels by 2020.. To increase access to safe and quality services through improved capacity of the health network to provide safe, quality Essential Packages of Health Services.

title.narrative: LBR-M-PII Progress Report
LBR-M-PII Program Agreement 4
LBR-M-PII Program Agreement 5
LBR-M-PII Program Agreement
LBR-M-PII Grant Performance Report
LBR-M-PII Implementation Letter 1
LBR-M-PII Implementation Letter 2
LBR-M-PII Implementation Letter 3
Coverage / Output indicator for LBR-M-PII
HSS-Other 2: Number of caregivers receiving IPC on cause, prevention & care/danger signs of malaria in the community (4 counties)
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
HSS-Other 1: Proportion of integrated community case management (iCCM) reports submitted by community health services supervisors (CHSS) within 15 days of the subsequent reporting month
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Outcome indicator for LBR-M-PII
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net
Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
Impact indicator for LBR-M-PII
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Maternal mortality ratio, per 100,000 population
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
All-cause under-5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
